descriptionProfile: President @CornellUniversity, computer scientist, linguist, and university administrator, serving higher education with a public purpose. #cornell

posts.description: Congratulations to the South Asian Council and their “Chai and Chat” dialogue series for being the 2018 recipients of our James A. Perkins Prize for Interracial and Intercultural Peace and Harmony. Our award reception on March 19 recognized students, professors, staff members and programs that are furthering the ideal of our diverse university community. We appreciate the campus-wide impact of all of the nominees – thank you for your work and dedication!

During a @CornellAlumni event in L.A., I had the honor of meeting with @CornellCAS alum, David Greenbaum ’98, co-head of production at Fox Searchlight Pictures, widely known for the award-winning films, “The Shape of Water,” and “Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri." Greenbaum even made sure to send me back to Cornell with a souvenir – a “Three Billboards” hat! #CornellAlumni

For three decades, our #Cornell scientists have worked on the historic Cassini mission. To commemorate the university’s role in this space exploration, which ended this past September, Cornell Center for Astrophysics and Planetary Science (CCAPS), the Department of Astronomy, and the Spacecraft Planetary Image Facility (SPIF) presented me with a gorgeous spacecraft model. I will find a special place for my miniature #Cassini in my office!

A wonderful Friday afternoon full of fascinating discussions on how we can leverage #ai in higher education advancement. Thank you @cornellalumni for hosting such an innovative and engaging #AIinAdvancement Summit!

While in Philadelphia this past weekend for #CALC2018, the Cornell Alumni Leadership Conference, I went down to the hotel restaurant to grab a bite to eat following my presentation. To my delight, I ended up having a wonderful evening with some of our alumni! This group of Cornellians from the 90’s and 00’s invited me to join their table for the evening. What a great time spent with our Big Red family.

The warmest of welcomes to our 62 students from Universidad de Puerto Rico (UPR) as they enter Cornell under a program that will continue their study following the devastation of Hurricane Maria last fall. Thank you to our supportive community that made hundreds of hats and mittens to help our guests transition into the Ithaca weather.

Had a great time rooting for our Big Red women’s hockey team as they faced off against Union College yesterday! Looking forward to watching many more games at Lynah Rink this season #LGR @cornellsports
Today, we remember and reflect on the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

Honored to attend the Infosys Science Awards during my travels in Bangalore, India. Cornell faculty member Kaushik Basu, pictured on the far left, chaired the Social Sciences committee of these awards, which recognizes top scientific research. Infosys Ltd. also has a strong Cornell connection with co-founder N.R. Narayana Murthy and newest CEO Salil Parekh both being Cornellians.
Best wishes for a joyous and peaceful holiday season.
I am incredibly proud of each and every one of our newest #Cornell2018 graduates. I look forward to hear about your future endeavors as @CornellAlumni. Congratulations!

Prepped and ready to observe a neurosurgery procedure at @WeillCornell. Thank you Dr. Philip E. Stieg, Chairman and Neurosurgeon-in-Chief, for the invitation to watch our doctors and research in action.

Thank you to Cornell Trustee Ratan Tata ’59, BArch ’62 and Tata Consultancy Services for supporting Cornell Tech with a $50 million commitment to support capital development and collaborative research on our Roosevelt Island campus. The Tata Innovation Center (formerly The Bridge) will become a hub for New York’s tech sector and a global icon for how academia and industry can collaborate to leverage technology for the greater good, while helping our Cornell Tech campus reach its full potential for education, research and societal impact.

This past weekend, I celebrated our many community-campus collaborations at the Town Gown Awards (TOGO). This year, Ithaca College President Shirley M. Collado and Tompkins Cortland Community College President Orinthia T. Montague joined us in recognizing local organizations and leaders in our community. Congratulations to all the winners!

As the inaugural speaker of our Free Speech Series, Erwin Chemerinsky, dean of Berkeley Law at the University of California, discussed the critical role of free speech in institutions of higher education Monday evening in the Alice Statler Auditorium.

Thank you Antonio DiTomasso and all of our Weiss Fellows for their inspiring and distinguished contributions to undergraduate education through the years. It was a privilege to recognize these faculty members at last night’s reception at the Johnson Museum.

This morning, Lt. Governor Kathy Hochul @ltgovhochulny announced a $15 million #NYS grant to the Cornell High Energy Synchrotron Source (CHESS), a high intensity X-ray source supported by the National Science Foundation. This grant will provide CHESS with new technology capabilities and create more partnerships across the Southern Tier to further enhance the #research done at this world-class facility for accelerator #science.
Today, I paid a visit to Professor Ron Ehrenberg’s class at the ILR School where I shared some of my past experiences in academia. Thank you for having me as a guest in your classroom.

On this Veteran’s Day, we honor those who serve our nation, including veterans and those on active military duty from within our community. As we recognize their bravery, I am pleased to reaffirm the university’s commitment to welcoming and supporting U.S. military veterans, and I invite you to join me in thanking Cornell’s veterans for all they have done on behalf of us all.

Congratulations to Robert F. Smith, Class of 1985, as the 2017 Cornell Entrepreneur of the Year, given each year to an outstanding Cornellian who demonstrates not only remarkable business achievement but also community service and high ethical standards. It is a pleasure to honor Robert at the sixth Cornell Entrepreneurship Summit NYC, and to join faculty, students, staff, alumni, and friends to celebrate Cornell’s thriving entrepreneurship ecosystem. Across our campuses in Ithaca and New York City, our scientists and scholars are developing ideas and products for the public good, students from all colleges and schools are taking part in innovation, and alumni share their wisdom as leaders in industries from healthcare to technology and media to finance. #CornellNYC #CUSummit
I hope all the Big Red families enjoyed their visit to campus during our First-Year Family Weekend. I had a lovely time chatting with parents following my talk in Statler Auditorium.
Enjoying #CornellHomecoming fireworks with my husband Ken
Getting in that #CornellHomecoming spirit! Welcome back to our alumni returning this weekend.

Yesterday's panel “Building Bridges Between Ithaca and Cornell Tech,” which included Howard Milstein ‘73, Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences Gretchen Ritter, Cornell Tech Dean Dan Huttenlocher, and Computing & Information Science Dean Greg Morrisett, discussed our collaborative programs connecting our Ithaca and New York City campuses. Our newest Milstein Program for Technology and Humanity, made possible by Howard Milstein ’73, Michael Milstein ’11 and family, will integrate undergraduate curriculum from both the College of Arts and Sciences and Cornell Tech. I cannot wait to see the impact of these initiatives. @cornellcas @cornell_tech

Thanks to the generosity of Dave Breazzano ‘MBA ’80, we officially have a new home in Collegetown for our students at the Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management. Today’s dedication of the Breazzano Family Center for Business Education concluded with a ribbon cutting by Dave Breazzano, Denise Frias, Dean Soumitra Dutta, Lourdes Casanova, Dean Mark Nelson, Roy Park Jr. and Prof Bob Libby. Looking forward to hearing the great ideas that will come from this collaborative center. #CornellMBA

Great discussion last night with Hatfield lecturer Paul Polman, CEO of Unilever, on how companies can create positive impact through initiatives centered on #sustainability. It was an honor having you on campus as the 35th Robert S. Hatfield Fellow in Economic Education.

Whether you listened in Klarman Hall or tuned in through our livestream - thank you to our staff for a great conversation this afternoon. You all are our university’s unsung heroes and I am looking forward to collaborating on important initiatives together.

It was a perfect fall weekend to spend time with our amazing community at the Employee Celebration. Saturday’s dinner festivities were certainly sweetened by Cornell Big Red football’s win over Harvard earlier that afternoon! #LGR

I was honored to join the incredibly talented students of the Cornell Symphony Orchestra and Cornell Chamber Orchestra as the narrator for the performance of “Journey into Jazz,” under the baton of Maestro Chris Kim.  After rehearsing with the students Friday evening, we performed for a terrific audience in Bailey Hall last night.

Thanks to Weill Cornell Medicine, Cornell’s roots in New York City go back more than a century. Following this week’s historic Cornell Tech dedication, I enjoyed an inauguration celebration at the Belfer Research Building with our many faculty, staff, students and alumni working across the five boroughs. Thank you to Dean Augustine Choi for hosting such a warm welcome.
#CornellNYC

Today’s dedication of the Cornell Tech campus on Roosevelt Island marks the beginning of a new era of opportunity not only for Cornell and our academic partners at the Technion, but also for New York City, the state and the world. At Cornell Tech, we are defining a new model for graduate education—one that melds cutting-edge research and education with entrepreneurship and real-world application. The best way to solve our biggest challenges is to gather a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds and disciplines. That’s what we do here at Cornell.
#CornellNYC #CornellTech

Did you know? There are more than 600 plant species found right inside the Liberty Hyde Bailey Conservatory. It was a perfect day to explore the diversity of plant life here with @cornelluniversitycals Dean Kathryn Boor ‘80 and plant sciences majors Patty Chan ’18 and Nicolas Glynos ’17.

Last week, I had the privilege of dining with @ithacacollege’s President Shirley M. Collado and @tompkinscortland President Orinthia T. Montague in downtown #Ithaca. Very excited for future collaborations with these inspiring leaders.

Spent some time in Olive Tjaden Hall today doing something I have suddenly developed quite a passion for - silkscreen! Thank you @cornellaap for this added bonus to my tour day. Looking forward to pulling more prints in your labs soon.

Exciting afternoon spent with faculty @CornellHumEc learning about all the innovative projects happening in #FiberScience, Policy Analysis and Management, Design + Environmental Analysis and much more.
What a fantastic turnout at the International Fair yesterday. It was great to see all of our departments showcasing the many ways students can travel abroad.

On Tuesday, Provost Michael Kotlikoff and I had the opportunity to meet with Kristina Johnson, who begins her tenure as SUNY chancellor on September 5. SUNY is an important partner of Cornell’s, and I look forward to working closely with her on many issues over the coming years.
What a fun way to kick off the new semester! Loved hanging out with the Keeton House Fellows – thank you Professor Steve Jackson for hosting us.
Thrilled to be invited to join Freshmen, returning upperclassmen, and new PhD students for great food and conversation at the Africana Center Welcome Back Barbeque. #CornellWelcome #Cornell2021

The energy at the new student convocation was inspiring! I can’t wait to begin a new semester with all of our students – new and returning.
#CornellWelcome #Cornell2021

I am excited to meet with our newest Cornellians and their families at Rawlings Green at 4 p.m. today. A big thanks to our Orientation volunteers, including Jenna Rudolfsky ’19, who help to make Move-In day extra special! #CornellWelcome #cornell2021
A Big Red #CornellWelcome to the incoming students here on campus for our Pre-Freshman Summer Program. I hope you all are enjoying your first summer at Cornell, I know I am! #Cornell2021
Thank you @CornellVet and Dean Lorin Warnick for having me in your labs today! I even got a peek at this animal simulator designed by associate professor Daniel Fletcher.

Getting an inside look at the science behind the Cornell High Energy Synchrotron Source (CHESS)! The high-intensity X-rays generated at CHESS help scientists conduct cutting-edge research in physics, chemistry, environmental sciences and more.
This past weekend, I visited the Little Moose Field Station in the Adirondacks, and had the opportunity to talk with students doing research on the local aquatic habitat.

Checking out one of the many products that can be made from industrial hemp with New York Governor Andrew Cuomo @nygovcuomo and Assemblywoman Donna Lupardo. This afternoon, @CornellUniversityCALS hosted an official bill-signing ceremony which will help New York’s industry grow in new ways.
Celebrating our country with family, friends - and fireworks! Happy Fourth of July, everyone!

What a treat to learn about the cutting-edge science going on at the Cornell Nanoscale Facility. Here we are dressed for the occasion! Thank you to Wade Wright, Don Tennent, Bob Burman and Chris Ober for giving me an inside look into the CNF (which is celebrating its 40th anniversary this year).
Enjoyed sharing anecdotes of my academic background and engaging in great dialogue at Bailey Hall this morning. Could feel the #CornellReunion magic in the air as we closed with the alma mater!
Excited to be spending my first #CornellReunion with all the Cornellians returning to campus.

The secret behind our blooming, springtime campus? Our dedicated facilities staff members! Loved stopping by the Palm Road facility earlier this week to thank the team that keeps our campus beautiful.

Couldn't have picked a better place, time and occasion for my first official Big Red selfie as @cornellpresident -- Commencement at Schoellkopf Stadium with just a few of my closest Cornellian friends! #Cornell2017
Congratulations to #Cornell2017! The recognition of your achievements is well-deserved, and wherever your life’s path leads, you will always be a part of a special community known as Cornellians.

Today we celebrated the outstanding accomplishments of our Merrill Presidential Scholars – and the teachers that ensured their success every step of the way! Along with her professor Michael Tomlin of the College of Architecture, Art, and Planning, Hadar Sachs ’17 of Cupertino, CA welcomed her former high school teacher, April Scott of Monta Vista High School. Best of luck to all the scholars as they embark on new journeys soon! #cornell2017
Am I the only one thinking about my summer reading list? #cornellstore

The Meet and Greet Event in Willard Straight Hall last Friday was a fantastic way for me to connect with some of our awesome students! Enjoyed chatting with Eddy Crux ’17 and Jenny Olguin ’17, both students at the Hotel School.

Can I get a drum roll please? I had a great time celebrating the upcoming construction of the Maplewood housing project for graduate students this afternoon. I also loved hanging out with the Original Cornell Syncopators!
Thrilled to have a big welcome from NYS Assembly member Barbara Lifton and Speaker Carl Heastie in Albany today.

Friday evening, I ventured out to the Lab of Ornithology for the Student Fellowship reception. I had a lovely time speaking with faculty and getting to know some of our student scholars and families, which included Rachel Mitnick, Arts and Sciences ’17.

Say cheese! This afternoon, I sampled students’ grilled cheese creations during the 7th Annual Harry Greene Grilled Cheese Challenge. First place went to Olivia Graham and Young Suh - here they are posing with their golden spatula!

Last night, I attended Advisory Council Receptions at both the College of Human Ecology and the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, and at each I had the privilege of addressing faculty, staff, students and alumni. I also got to chat with members of the class of 2017.

Yesterday, I participated in Cornell Dairy’s longstanding tradition and sampled ice cream for my unique presidential flavor. What’s the scoop on my flavor?  We’ll announce that closer to my August 25 inauguration. Stay tuned!
Hi, Cornell! It’s my first week as President (and my first Instagram.) Today, I paid a visit to the Marketing photo studio in Collegetown for my official portraits.
Interim President Hunter Rawlings and wife Elizabeth Rawlings take in the sights of #DragonDay17

President Hunter Rawlings and his wife, Elizabeth Rawlings, were honored with a celebratory reception and dinner March 23 by the Board of Trustees. Paying homage to President Rawlings’ academic department, Classics, guests included a toga-donned Touchdown, the Big Red Bear. Hunter and Elizabeth Rawlings are joined here by Robert S. Harrison ’76, right, chairman of the Board of Trustees. #Cornell

At a “Get Out of Your College!” forum organized by Charles Van Loan, dean of the university faculty, and Rebecca Stoltzfus, vice provost for undergraduate education, Cornell professors and academic advisers spoke on ways to encourage students to broaden their academic experiences through electives and other options outside of their majors. The panel included (left to right) Catherine Appert, assistant professor of music; Bonnie Comella, director of undergraduate advising in the College of Arts and Sciences; Mark Cruvellier, professor and chair of architecture; Anna Haskins, assistant professor of sociology; and Jon Kleinberg, professor of computer science and information science.

Fisk Johnson shares a warm moment with Cornell students and community members at an event to honor the landmark $150 million gift to name the Cornell SC Johnson College of Business. This transformative gift provides permanent support for business education at Cornell and will significantly enhance the exceptional scholarship and research at the Charles H. Dyson School of Applied Economics and Management, the School of Hotel Administration, and the Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management that constitute the Cornell SC Johnson College of Business. It is with heartfelt gratitude that we thank Fisk Johnson and SC Johnson. #cornellbusiness

H. Fisk Johnson and SC Johnson have committed $150 million to name and endow the Cornell SC Johnson College of Business. This generous gift will transform business education at Cornell, providing significant and ongoing support for the faculty, students and programs of the College. The Johnson family legacy of giving to Cornell extends more than 120 years. We are exceedingly grateful for their support.

I am pleased to announce that Dr. Augustine M.K. Choi has been named the Stephen and Suzanne Weiss Dean of Weill Cornell Medicine and Cornell University’s provost for medical affairs. Dr. Choi is an internationally renowned physician-scientist in the field of lung disease, and has served extremely successfully as interim dean of @WeillCornell Medical since June 2016.

Today we remember the life and legacy of Martin Luther King Jr. 
A collection at the Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives documents King’s support of the health care workers unions. #mlk

A thank you -- and many debts of gratitude --- to the members of the Cornell Undergraduate Veterans Association, who gathered in the War Memorial shrine room on Veterans Day to donate a flag honoring fallen Cornell veterans and military personnel.

A small group of veterans, along with a couple of ROTC cadets, gathered at Cornell’s War Memorial arch in celebration of the 241st birthday of the Marine Corps on the eve of Veterans Day. The Cornell community is honoring veterans and military personnel in numerous ways this week, leading up to and throughout today's holiday.
Interim President Hunter R. Rawlings III receives a standing ovation from trustees and members of the Cornell Council during the Joint Annual Meeting and State of the University Address.

Interim President Hunter Rawlings thanks retiring New York State Sen. Michael Nozzolio '73, M.S. '77, R-54th Dist., for his service during a Cornell Board of Trustees meeting in Statler Amphitheater Thursday during the Trustee-Council Annual Meeting.

Celebrating the official dedication Friday of the Robert Frederick Smith School of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering. Smith '85 is founder, chairman and CEO of Vista Equity Partners, and the foundation of which he is a founding director.

Interim President Hunter R. Rawlings III delivers the annual President's Address to Staff Oct. 11 in Kennedy Hall's Call Auditorium. "Get involved," he told the staff community, urging them to use innovation and ingenuity to do things differently. “You are part of a very remarkable institution … with an enormous footprint and an enormous impact,” Rawlings said.
Interim President, Hunter Rawlings participates in the coin toss before #CornellHomecoming football game. @CornellUniversity went on to defeat Yale 27-13.

Investigative journalist and nonfiction writer Svetlana Alexievich, left, who won the 2015 Nobel Prize in literature, gave the Bartels World Affairs Fellowship Lecture, “Voices From the People: The Rise and Fall of the Russian-Soviet Dream” Sept. 12 in Statler Auditorium. At right is her translator, Raissa Kravitsky. The Bartels fellowship and lecture were established in 1984 to bring prominent international leaders to @cornelluniversity to foster a broadened world view among #Cornell students and is organized by the Mario Einaudi Center for International Studies.

Over the weekend, #CornellPresident had the opportunity to extend a #CornellWelcome to the Class of 2020 and their families. During his convocation speech, President Rawlings encouraged students to take full advantage of the many academic opportunities ahead of them during their time @cornelluniversity
Using ancient Greek texts on war and honor to teach critical reading skills, #CornellPresident Rawlings led one of the class sessions in the 2016 Warrior-Scholar Project July 27. #Humanities
Happy 4th of July and Independence Day — the Ithaca Community Fireworks Celebration is stunning whether in the city or up on campus.

Interim President Hunter R. Rawlings III delivered the State of the University Address Saturday morning in Bailey Hall during Reunion Weekend, emphasizing the importance of research and teaching to Cornell’s core mission and taking several questions from an appreciative audience of alumni and trustees.

#CornellPresident Hunter Rawlings, Cornell Law Professor Michael Dorf and Harvard Law Professor Michael Klarman discuss the “History of the U.S. Constitution” during an academic panel leading up to the dedication of @CornellCAS Klarman Hall. #humanities

Earlier this week, the Office of Faculty Development & Diversity held its spring reception where Pres. Rawlings was able to engage with faculty from across the university. Pictured: CALS Professor Rui Hai Liu.
“I have a deep fondness for Cornell, and it is an honor to once again be called to help lead this great institution.” —Hunter Rawlings
The search for #Cornell's 14th president is underway.

Dear Cornell Community,

It is with utmost sadness that I write to inform you that our president, colleague and friend, Elizabeth Garrett, passed away late last evening after a brave battle with colon cancer. There are few words to express the enormity of this loss.

Beth was simply a remarkable human being -- a vibrant and passionate leader who devoted her life to the pursuit of knowledge and public service and had a profound, positive impact on the many lives that she touched. In this regard, she was the quintessential Cornellian. From the moment I met her during the presidential search, it was clear to me that she had the intellect, energy and vision not only to lead Cornell, but to be one of the greatest presidents in our 150-year history. While Beth’s tenure as president has tragically been cut short, her efforts over the last eight months have set the university on a path toward continued excellence. She will leave a lasting legacy on our beloved institution and will be terribly missed.

We will honor Beth’s memory with a moment of silence, followed by chimes, this afternoon at 4:00pm EST. I invite you to mark this moment either by yourself or with colleagues and friends. Plans will soon be made for a memorial gathering on the Ithaca campus in the near future. We will share details as soon as they are available.

On behalf of our entire community, Acting President Kotlikoff and I offer our heartfelt condolences to Beth’s husband, Professor Andrei Marmor, and the rest of the Marmor and Garrett families.

Sadly,

Robert S. Harrison
Chairman, Cornell University Board of Trustees

#BlackLivesMatter has pushed issues of race-related violence to the forefront of our national consciousness, catalyzing political action and media scrutiny,  and asking us all to examine ourselves and our institutions – not just law enforcement but all of our social and governmental institutions. It has been seen as a model by activists in other countries and inspired protests and discussions on college campuses around the world, including here @CornellUniversity. 
Janaya Khan, co-founder of #BlackLivesMatter Toronto and international ambassador for the #BLM Network, speaks in Sage Chapel at the 2016 #MLK Commemorative Lecture. –EG.

I am so pleased about the $50 million gift from Robert F. Smith ’85 and his foundation, Fund II Foundation, to support chemical and biomolecular engineering and underrepresented students at the College of Engineering. In recognition of this gift, the university will name the Robert Frederick Smith School of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering at Cornell, as well as the Robert Frederick Smith Tech Scholars Program spanning Cornell Engineering and @Cornell_Tech –EG.

Had an enlightening and productive day in the state capital Tuesday for Cornell Day in Albany, where I met with Lt. Gov. Kathy Hochul, chatted with Cornell alumni lawmakers and saw so many examples of what Cornell's colleges and schools do for New York state. –EG.
Always proud to root for our Big Red teams — tonight as part of the Lynah Faithful cheering on the men’s ice hockey team as they faced Harvard. #LGR! –EG.

As we celebrate the completion of Klarman Hall for the humanities, we also take pride in the humanities scholarship and creative work produced by Cornell faculty and students.
Patricia Keller, assistant professor of Spanish Literature, moving her belongings into her new home, the beautiful Klarman Hall. –EG.
It is a beautiful winter afternoon in #Ithaca. –EG.
It is a quiet January morning at the Big Red Barn, a central meeting space for our graduate students and their families. –EG.
Congratulations January Graduates on all of your achievements at #Cornell, and best wishes for a continuous adventure of the mind and heart. –EG.
Touchdown helped me to welcome alumni to an event in Myron Taylor Hall yesterday. My tour to meet alumni across the globe resumes on Jan. 15 in India. –EG.
May the new year ring in peace and joy. Warm wishes this holiday season! –EG.
Congratulations to successful early decision applicants! Welcome #Cornell2020! #MyCornellMoment –EG.

Over the coming months, I will be meeting with Cornellians from across the U.S. and abroad. The second stop on my tour took me to Amazon Headquarters in Seattle, WA. Our next event is in Ithaca, and then off to India! –EG.

Please join me in welcoming Fred Van Sickle, our new vice president for alumni affairs and development. Fred brings broad experience and a proven track record of accomplishment in higher education fundraising and community building. He will begin his new position Jan. 18. –EG.
Topping-off the net-zero emissions Bloomberg Center @Cornell_Tech on Roosevelt Island, and celebrating the @CornellUniversity partnership with #NYC –EG.

Very excited to get to appear on the GardenVision screen @MadisonSquareGarden for Red Hot Hockey Saturday along with so many #Cornell fans — and kudos to our #BigRed @CornellMensHockey team, who held off a late rally by Boston University and ultimately ended with a tie game in overtime. –EG.
What can make a Sunday stroll around beautiful Beebe Lake even better? Doing so with the company of more than 75 students, staff, faculty and their families. –EG.
Coffee & Conversation hour was a great way to end the week. I am looking forward to more opportunities to connect with our students. –EG.

All members of our community are welcome to join Provost Michael Kotlikoff, Vice President Ryan Lombardi and me for an energizing stroll around Beebe Lake this Sunday. We will depart from Appel Commons at 9:30 a.m. Enjoy the natural beauty of our campus, hot chocolate and conversation! –EG.
Chatting with Graham Kerslick from the Atkinson Center for a Sustainable Future about the importance of connecting with policymakers and the public in the quest for a more sustainable world. –EG.

World War II Memorial in the rotunda of Anabel Taylor Hall, which also honors casualties suffered by #Cornell in other conflicts. We are proud to honor our service men and women today.  #VeteransDay –EG.

#Cornell student Sam Langer '17 helps me to present his father Robert Langer ’70 with the 2015 Cornell Entrepreneur of the Year award. Robert’s accomplishments demonstrate the extraordinary impact of Cornellians around the world, and serve as outstanding examples for our students. –EG.
We are delighted that you are joining us for Parents’ Weekend. Welcome to campus #CornellParents! –EG.
Meet Ivy! This precious beagle was born @CornellVet –EG.

I take great pride in hearing about the research of our #Cornell faculty. During my recent visit to the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, evolutionary biologist Prof. Amy McCune spoke about work being done by Prof. David Winkler’s group, which is using solar tracking tags to study bird movements and “lab-on-the-go” tags that monitor their physiological condition during migration. –EG.

President Emeritus Frank H.T. Rhodes, his wife Rosa, and Provost Michael Kotlikoff were among so many of Cornell’s leaders, faculty, alumni and friends who attended my first State of the University Address this past weekend during the Trustee-Council Annual Meeting. –EG.

Taking a moment with #Cornell senior Garrett Guillen of Los Angeles, a Class of '74 Scholar, to appreciate this stunning #CornellAlumniMagazine artwork (by William Benson '72) of notable Cornellians, of which I was honored to be included! The original artwork was a gift of the Class of '74. –EG.
I could not ask for better fall foliage for my first autumn in upstate NY. –EG.
It was a pleasure meeting so many staff members and their families during our annual Employee Celebration Dinner Friday evening in Barton Hall. –EG.

It was a pleasure meeting Jessica Weiss, associate professor of government, and so many other new faculty members who enhance our community of scholars, artists, teachers and researchers at a welcome reception for new women faculty in the College of Arts & Sciences. –EG.
Getting into the Big Red spirit during my first Cornell Homecoming game. –EG.
I love this picture — Emma, the girl in the picture, came to hear the first woman president speak and asked me to sign her book.  It was one of the best moments in the day for me. –EG.
Glad to see everyone enjoying the new 24 Garrett Swirl at the Community Picnic! –EG.

I was honored to receive this specially bound edition of “The Norton Anthology of M.H. Abrams” that was given to guests at the remembrance service for Professor Emeritus M.H. Abrams in Statler Auditorium Sept. 12. Members of the English department and I welcomed friends, colleagues and the community to this special memorial celebration for Prof. Abrams, the Class of 1916 Professor Emeritus of English, a towering figure in literary and cultural studies, who spent his entire career here at Cornell after arriving in 1945 and was the longtime editor of the “Norton Anthology of English Literature.” He died this past April at the age of 102. –EG.
The first apples of the season being sorted by Larry this weekend at the #Cornell Orchards. –EG.
Bear Walk helps newcomers become a member of the Collegetown community. –EG.
Students explore, discover, connect with global opportunities at international fair. #Cornell –EG.
It was a pleasure meeting so many new students and their families over the weekend. Looking forward to a great year! #Cornell –EG.
It was delightful meeting so many members of the Class of 2019 and other new students today and their families -- an inspiring and meaningful #CornellWelcome for all! –EG.
We are new Cornellians, too! Enjoying my first move-in day and orientation with VP Lombardi #CornellWelcome –EG.
Traveling from #Ithaca to #NYC without leaving campus! –EG.
Attending a concert at the Forte Piano Festival which features period instruments from the 1800s. –EG.

At a roundtable discussion with Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand, Deputy Asst Secy of Commerce Matt Erskine and other distinguished guests on entrepreneurship and economic development in the #SouthernTier. #REVithaca #Cornell –EG.
Great dinner with my two new friends, @IthacaCollege President Thomas Rochon and @TC3_official President Carl Haynes at #coltivareithaca #cornell –EG.

What an honor to be the 10th Cornell president to shake hands with Professor Emeritus Jim White ’39, Ph.D. ’44. Presidents Farrand, Day, Malott, Perkins, Corson, Rhodes, Rawlings, Lehman, Skorton, and me! #Cornell –EG.
Getting ready to visit our nanoscale facility clean room in Duffield Hall with Provost-elect Mike Kotlikoff. #Cornell –EG.
Thanks to Bill Sitzabee for my hard hat tour of Klarman Hall. @IPPProgramming, @CornellCAS, #Cornell –EG.
Very excited to meet some of our new students at the pre-frosh summer program dinner. #Cornell –EG.
Great meeting today with #Ithaca Mayor Svante Myrick. Looking forward to our continued partnership and success. #Cornell –EG.
Settling into my new office in Day Hall. #Cornell –EG.
Answering great questions from our University Relations team #Cornell –EG.
Hello Instagram! #myfirstinstagram –EG.
